text: Jonah
Jonah Disobeys Yahweh
And the word of Yahweh came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,
“Get up! Go to the great city Nineveh and cry out against her, because their evil has come up ⸤before me⸥.”\f + \fr 1:2 \ft Literally “to my face” \f*

But Jonah set out to flee toward Tarshish from ⸤the presence of⸥\f + \fr 1:3 \ft Literally “from to face of” \f* Yahweh. And he went down \add to\add* Joppa and found a merchant ship going \add to\add* Tarshish, and paid her fare, and went on board her to go with them toward Tarshish from ⸤the presence of⸥\f + \fr 1:3 \ft Literally “from to face of” \f* Yahweh.
And Yahweh hurled a great wind upon the sea, and it was a great storm on the sea, and the merchant ship ⸤was in danger of breaking up⸥.\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Literally “threatened to be broken up” \f*

And the mariners were afraid, and each cried out to his god. And they threw the ⸤contents⸥\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Literally “objects” \f* that were in the merchant ship into the sea to lighten it for them. And \add meanwhile\add* Jonah went down into the hold of the vessel and lay down and fell asleep.

And the captain\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Or “commander” \f* of the ship approached him and said to him, “Why are you ⸤sound asleep⸥?\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Literally “in a deep sleep” \f* Get up! Call on your god! Perhaps \add your\add* god\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Literally “the god,” with the article indicating previous reference \f* will take notice of us and we won’t perish!”

And they said ⸤to one another⸥,\f + \fr 1:7 \ft Literally “each to his friend/companion” \f* “Come, let us cast lots so that we may know on whose account this disaster \add has come\add* on us!” And they cast lots, and the lot fell on Jonah.

So they said to him, “Please tell us whoever \add is responsible that\add* this disaster \add has come\add* upon us! What \add is\add* your occupation? And from where do you come? What \add is\add* your country? And from which people \add are\add* you?”
And he said to them, “I \add am\add* a Hebrew, and I fear Yahweh, the God of heaven, who made the sea and the dry land.”

Then the men ⸤were greatly afraid⸥,\f + \fr 1:10 \ft Literally “were afraid with a great fear” \f* and they said to him, “What \add is\add* this you have done?” because they\f + \fr 1:10 \ft Literally “the men” but this is redundant in English \f* knew that he \add was\add* fleeing ⸤from the presence of⸥\f + \fr 1:10 \ft Literally “from before the face of” \f* Yahweh (because he had told them).

So they said to him, “What shall we do to you so that the sea may quiet down for us?” because the sea ⸤was growing more and more tempestuous⸥.\f + \fr 1:11 \ft Literally “going/growing and storming” \f*
And he said to them, “Pick me up and hurl me into the sea so that the sea may quiet down for you, because I know that on account of me this great storm \add has come\add* upon you all.”

But the men rowed \add hard\add* to bring \add the ship\add*\f + \fr 1:13 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context \f* back to the dry land, and they could not \add do so\add* because the sea ⸤was growing more and more tempestuous⸥\f + \fr 1:13 \ft Literally “going/growing and storming” \f* against them.

So they cried out to Yahweh, and they said, “O Yahweh! Please do not let us perish because of this man’s life, and ⸤do not make us guilty of innocent blood⸥,\f + \fr 1:14 \ft Literally “do not give innocent blood on us” \f* because you, O Yahweh, did what you wanted.”
And they picked Jonah up and hurled him into the sea, and the sea ceased from its raging.
So the men feared Yahweh ⸤greatly⸥,\f + \fr 1:16 \ft Literally “with a great fear” \f* and they offered a sacrifice to Yahweh and ⸤made⸥\f + \fr 1:16 \ft Literally “vowed” \f* vows.
Jonah Is Swallowed by a Fish and Prays to Yahweh

\f + \fr 1:17 \ft \xt Jonah 1:17–2:10 \ft in the English Bible is 2:1–11 in the Hebrew Bible \f* And Yahweh provided a large fish to swallow up Jonah, and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.
